intro: Putoria calabrica subsp. hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish putoria, is a rare and endemic plant species native to southern Spain. It is a small, herbaceous shrub that typically grows in rocky and limestone-rich soils. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers during the spring season. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought-resistant characteristics. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
